newsitem.title: CROATIA: Eurokuna gets Croat listing, trade halted till February.
newsitem.headline: Eurokuna gets Croat listing, trade halted till February.

text.p: The Zagreb Stock Exchange said on Tuesday it listed Croatia's first sovereign debt issue of 300 million kuna-denominated Eurobonds, launched in December 1996.
But proper trade will be halted till February 17, the end of a lock-up period by which actual bonds must be issued to investors, Vladimir Puskaric of the listing committee told Reuters by telephone.
The issue, yielding a fixed 12.5 percent a year, was offered in equal portions of 150 million kuna to foreign and Croatian investors.
It was selling at 98.50 percent of the 10,000 kuna face value of bonds by January 7. They mature on December 18, 1998.
Each buyer got a letter of entitlement, which can only be traded back to the bank that sold them in the first place, Puskaric said.
Four Croatian banks -- Zagrebacka, Trgovacka, Varazdinska and Dalmatinska -- undertook to make a market in Eurokuna in Croatia.
